fields.summary: Purge does not work when simple authorisation plugin is used

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: webconsole
components.description: Web console such as the old and the new hawtio console

fields.summary: Purge through webconsole fails if authorizationPlugin is used

comments.body:
I believe that I am having the same issue.  This was working fine for us in 5.6, but failed when we upgraded to 5.10.  We also tried to update to 5.7, and it fails there too.  The other symptom that we see is that attempts to use the sendMessage function of the webconsole returns the following error in the browser:
{noformat}
Exception occurred while processing this request, check the log for more information!
{noformat}

And the following in the activemq.log:
{noformat}
2014-10-27 17:49:03,771 [//localhost#105] WARN  TransportConnection            - Failed to add Connection ID:dev-jms1-44015-1412438005557-56116:5
java.lang.SecurityException: User name [admin] or password is invalid.

These actions work fine if authorizationPlugin is commented out of the activemq.xml config.
